tool_description: Identifies wild edible plant species based on physical characteristics and location data, providing confidence scores and botanical information.

plant_height_cm.description: Height of the plant in centimeters

leaf_shape.description: Primary leaf shape: oval, lance, heart, lobed, compound, needle, linear

leaf_arrangement.description: How leaves are arranged: alternate, opposite, whorled, basal

flower_color.description: Primary flower color if present: white, yellow, red, blue, purple, pink, green

habitat_type.description: Primary habitat: forest, meadow, wetland, coastal, desert, mountain, disturbed

geographic_region.description: Geographic region: northeast, southeast, midwest, southwest, northwest, canada, europe, asia

error_messages: Invalid leaf shape: Use one of [oval, lance, heart, lobed, compound, needle, linear]
Invalid leaf arrangement: Use one of [alternate, opposite, whorled, basal]
Invalid habitat type: Use one of [forest, meadow, wetland, coastal, desert, mountain, disturbed]
Invalid geographic region: Use one of [northeast, southeast, midwest, southwest, northwest, canada, europe, asia]
Plant height must be positive: Provide a height value greater than 0
Insufficient data for identification: Provide more specific characteristics for accurate identification
usage: Input observable plant characteristics including height, leaf details, habitat, and location. The tool will return potential species matches with confidence levels and safety warnings.

edibility_status.description: Edibility classification: edible, toxic, medicinal, unknown
